intro: Engelmannia peristenia, commonly known as the redstem or redstem twining plant, is a flowering plant species native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its twining growth habit and showy, pink to reddish flowers. The plant has alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are usually hairy, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Engelmannia peristenia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
